triples.name: Rust (programming language)
triples.relevance: Verus is a formal verification tool specifically designed for Rust programs, enabling proof expression in Rust's own syntax.

triples.name: Type system
triples.relevance: The paper leverages Rust's powerful type system for safely checking linearity and borrowing in verified programs.

triples.name: Substructural type system
triples.relevance: Linear types are a form of substructural types that enforce resource usage constraints in Verus specifications.

triples.name: Linear logic
triples.relevance: Linear types in Verus correspond to linear logic, ensuring objects are used exactly once for safe resource management.

triples.name: Memory safety
triples.relevance: Verus enables formal verification of memory safety properties beyond Rust's type system guarantees.

triples.name: Formal verification
triples.relevance: Formal verification is the core task that Verus addresses, proving functional correctness of Rust programs.

triples.name: Satisfiability modulo theories
triples.relevance: Verus uses SMT solvers as its backend to automatically prove properties of verified programs.

triples.name: Lambda calculus
triples.relevance: Verus formalizes its linearity and borrowing semantics using a small lambda calculus for type safety proofs.

triples.name: Type safety
triples.relevance: Verus proves type safety and termination properties for specifications and proofs in its formal model.

triples.name: Doubly linked list
triples.relevance: The paper demonstrates Verus on an xor-based doubly linked list as a pointer-manipulating code example.

triples.name: Pointer (computer programming)
triples.relevance: Verus enables safe verification of pointer-manipulating code through linear ghost types and permissions.

triples.name: Mutability
triples.relevance: Verus handles interior mutability patterns in Rust, allowing safe mutation through verified abstractions.

triples.name: Concurrent computing
triples.relevance: Verus demonstrates verification of concurrent code and safe management of concurrent resources.
